categories.title: Recent Developments in AI Plugins and Tools

content.text: The integration of Langchain with Eliza is progressing, with improvements underway. Early testers are being sought for feedback.

A token prediction plugin is being developed, following a feedback loop of data, prediction, checks, evaluation, and token summary. The developer is looking for collaboration on reinforcement learning implementation.

A tech-support bot using Eliza is in development, focusing on JavaScript, Bitcoin, and GitHub repositories. The bot will run locally using Ollama on a Linux desktop with an NVIDIA GeForce 3060 (12GB VRAM) and aims to integrate with Telegram and Nostr.
Aigent.sh, a platform making AI agents accessible to non-technical users, is being developed with daily updates. Feedback is being sought from early users.
Mem0 AI SDK Provider has been proposed as a new provider in the Vercel AI SDK, introducing a separate memory layer for users.
A DexPaprika plugin has been created to fetch on-chain token prices across 20+ chains, with a free API that has rate limits.
A Twitter plugin update has been submitted, allowing data about created posts to be fetched back to the calling client.
A distributed storage plugin has been proposed for Eliza’s Plugin Registry, with reviews and feedback requested.
A broken link issue in the plugin registry was reported and is being investigated.
A versioning question was raised regarding when a merged PR would be included and how to reference it in a project, but no response was recorded.
AI-news aggregation is being set up to summarize discussions from multiple Discord channels.

The idea of centralizing README files for Eliza plugins was proposed by 'dankvr' to improve documentation and facilitate idea generation. This would help in organizing information more effectively and making it easier for developers to find relevant details.
'youngphlo' inquired whether README files had been ingested into 'jintern'. 'dankvr' confirmed that they had not, but agreed that centralizing them would be beneficial.

categories.title: ElizaOS Development Updates and Community Discussions

content.text:
### Plugin Development and Maintenance
- `freytes` took over maintenance of `plugin-rabbi-trader`, and `odilitime` unarchived it.
- `dankvr` pointed out missing plugin versions in the registry and linked the registry JSON.
- `0xn1c0` and `thelowmays9527` noted that `plugin-image`, `plugin-video`, and `plugin-tts` were missing from the registry.
- `chris.troutner` found that `plugin-local-ai` supports Ollama API but is not listed in the registry.
- `whysosaket` submitted a PR to add Mem0 as a provider in the Vercel AI SDK.
- `0xmattsroka` created a DexPaprika plugin for fetching on-chain token prices across 20+ chains.
- `tadeuchi` submitted a PR to update the Twitter plugin to fetch post data.
- `fforbeck` submitted a PR for a distributed storage plugin.
- `flaneurofmetaverses` reported a broken link in the plugin registry.

### Technical Issues and Fixes
- `nooters_` faced authentication errors running Eliza in Docker; `m1337d` suggested checking environment variables, which resolved the issue.
- `phonique_` encountered an invalid embedding input error.
- `4n7m4n` faced errors installing the Discord client due to missing `@elizaos/plugin-sql@^0.25.6`.
- `rick02533` advised `newbx0_02229` to set `ragKnowledge=false` for string arrays to improve Eliza’s knowledge retention.
- `funboy` encountered an infinite loop in a Twitch chatbot; `k_benny` suggested ignoring agent-generated messages, and `funboy` resolved it by ensuring actions/evaluators return JSON instead of plain text.
- `kalaudius` and others faced an SQLite module error, which was resolved with `pnpm add better-sqlite3@latest --force` and `npm rebuild better-sqlite3`.

### AI and Agent Development
- `shivam_18795` confirmed that Langchain is integrated with Eliza and is being improved. He is looking for early testers.
- `dorianjanezic` developed a token prediction plugin and is seeking feedback on implementing reinforcement learning.
- `chris.troutner` is building a tech-support bot using Eliza, focusing on JavaScript, Bitcoin, and GitHub repositories. He plans to integrate with Telegram and Nostr.
- `dtb0x` introduced `aigent.sh`, a platform making AI agents accessible to non-technical users, powered by ElizaOS.

### Documentation and Feature Requests
- `dankvr` suggested centralizing README files for Eliza plugins to improve documentation.
- `cjft` suggested adding an `AUTH_KEY` in `.env` to secure API endpoints.
- `dankvr` requested help improving the docs frontpage and fixing broken links.
- `hish1639` asked about versioning and how to reference merged PRs in projects.
- `dankvr` set up AI-news aggregation for multiple Discord channels.
